subject: Investing
title: Real Estate Cycles Explained
description: A quick win: understand Real Estate Cycles Explained.

hook.text: In 2006 investors scrambled to buy. By 2009, prices had dropped 30% and panic set in.

buildup.text: Real estate moves in cycles: recovery, expansion, hyper-supply, and recession.

discovery.text: Each phase can last years. Expansion brings rising rents; hyper-supply brings overbuilding.

twist.text: Smart investors buy during recession when fear peaks and prices bottom out.

climax.text: Those who bought distressed homes in 2010 saw values double by 2020.

punchline.text: Understanding the cycle is the closest thing to a crystal ball.

quiz.question: Which phase of the real estate cycle follows hyper-supply?
